episodeTitle: Merciless Fight to the Death! Luffy vs. Crocodile
episodeTitleJapanese: 情無用の死闘！ルフィVSクロコダイル
episodeTitleRomanized: Jōmuyō no Shitō! Rufi tai Kurokodairu
description: The Straw Hat crew and Vivi traverse the Sandora Desert toward Alubarna. When Crocodile intercepts them and captures Vivi with his hook, Luffy switches places with her and engages the Warlord in combat. Their first battle showcases Crocodile's devastating sand powers as Luffy struggles against his first Logia-type Devil Fruit opponent. The episode ends dramatically with Luffy being impaled by Crocodile's poisoned hook.

events.title: Hasami's Debut
events.description: Hasami, a giant desert crab, makes his first appearance as emergency transportation for the Straw Hat Pirates. Chopper learns about him from Matsuge as a friendly moving crab who can help them reach Alubarna quickly.
events.significance: Introduces a new ally creature that helps the Straw Hats in their desperate race to stop the rebellion. Hasami becomes a recurring character in Arabasta.

events.title: Reaching the Sandora River
events.description: The Straw Hats riding Hasami reach the Sandora River, a massive 50-kilometer-wide river that cuts through Arabasta. Hasami must stop here as crabs cannot cross water.
events.significance: The Sandora River presents a geographical obstacle that forces the crew to dismount and find another way across, setting up their vulnerable position when Crocodile attacks.

events.title: Crocodile Intercepts the Crew
events.description: Crocodile appears in the desert using his sand powers, blocking the Straw Hats' path to Alubarna. He demonstrates his mastery over the desert environment, making it clear he won't let them interfere with his plans.
events.significance: This confrontation marks the beginning of the climactic showdown between Luffy and his first Warlord opponent. It shows Crocodile's confidence and dominance in his element.

quotes.text: You've come all this way, but your journey ends here in the desert.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile confronts the Straw Hats before they can reach Alubarna

events.title: Luffy Switches Places with Vivi
events.description: When Crocodile catches Vivi with his hook, threatening her life, Luffy immediately switches places with her and takes the hit himself. He declares he'll fight Crocodile and tells his crew to go ahead without him.
events.significance: This moment demonstrates Luffy's selfless nature and his commitment to protecting his friends. It also sets up the one-on-one battle that both fighters have been anticipating.

quotes.text: I'll take care of this guy. You all go on ahead!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy volunteers to face Crocodile alone so his crew can continue to Alubarna

events.title: Luffy vs. Crocodile - Round 1 Begins
events.description: Luffy and Crocodile begin their first serious battle. Crocodile gives Luffy a three-minute time limit, confident he can defeat him quickly. This is Luffy's first encounter with a Logia-type Devil Fruit user in combat.
events.significance: This battle is a crucial learning experience for Luffy, introducing him to the concept of Logia intangibility and the need to find creative solutions to overcome seemingly invincible opponents. It's a major milestone in the Arabasta Arc.

quotes.text: Three minutes. That's all the time you have left to live.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile arrogantly sets a time limit for the battle

events.title: Luffy's Attacks Pass Through Crocodile
events.description: Luffy discovers that his physical attacks, including Gomu Gomu no Pistol and other techniques, pass harmlessly through Crocodile's body as he transforms into sand. This is Luffy's first experience with Logia intangibility.
events.significance: This moment is a crucial realization for Luffy about the nature of Logia Devil Fruits and the challenge they present. It forces him to think strategically rather than relying on brute force.

events.title: Desert Spada Debut
events.description: Crocodile reveals his Desert Spada technique, creating a blade of fast-moving sand that cuts through the ground like a torpedo. The attack can slice opponents in half and drains moisture from anything it touches.
events.significance: This is the first major offensive technique Crocodile demonstrates in battle, showcasing both the cutting power and dehydration abilities of the Suna Suna no Mi. It establishes Crocodile as a formidable opponent with precise, deadly attacks.

quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile unleashes his sand blade attack against Luffy

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Baku Baku Debut
events.description: Luffy uses Gomu Gomu no Baku Baku, stretching his mouth wide open to chomp at Crocodile in a fashion similar to Wapol's Baku Baku no Mi powers. Crocodile dodges but is momentarily infuriated by the ridiculous attack.
events.significance: This technique shows Luffy's creativity in adapting moves he's seen from other fighters. Though ineffective against Crocodile's Logia body, it demonstrates Luffy's willingness to try any strategy.

events.title: Desert Girasole Debut
events.description: Crocodile demonstrates Desert Girasole (Desert Sunflower), stabbing the ground to create a massive sinkhole of quicksand. The technique causes the desert to collapse into a giant pit, sucking in and burying anything caught in it.
events.significance: This technique showcases Crocodile's complete mastery over desert terrain, turning the battlefield itself into a weapon. It demonstrates why he's so dangerous in his element and foreshadows the environmental challenges Luffy must overcome.

quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile creates a massive quicksand pit to trap Luffy

events.title: Barchan Debut
events.description: Crocodile uses Barchan, a sand-based technique that creates crescent-shaped sand dunes to attack or defend. The technique further demonstrates his versatility in manipulating sand.
events.significance: Another display of Crocodile's diverse arsenal of sand techniques, showing he has multiple approaches to combat beyond simple transformation.

events.title: Water Weakness Discovery
events.description: During the fight, Crocodile's hook pierces the water bottle around Luffy's neck (given by Toto). When the water splashes onto Crocodile's arm, Luffy suddenly manages to grab and squeeze it, discovering that water solidifies Crocodile's sand body and nullifies his Logia intangibility.
events.significance: This is the pivotal discovery that makes Crocodile beatable. Water becomes the key to Luffy's eventual victory, turning the tide of their battles. This moment plants the seed for Luffy's strategies in their future encounters.

events.title: Crocodile Impales Luffy with Poisoned Hook
events.description: Crocodile impales Luffy through the chest with his poisoned hook. The hook contains a deadly toxin, and Crocodile leaves Luffy to die in the quicksand, confident he has won. This appears to be a fatal blow.
events.significance: This is one of the most shocking moments in early One Piece, as Luffy seemingly suffers a fatal injury. It marks the end of Round 1 with Crocodile's overwhelming victory and sets up the dramatic question of how Luffy will survive and continue fighting.

quotes.text: You failed, Straw Hat. This is where you die.
quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile's final words to Luffy after impaling him with the poisoned hook

events.title: Luffy Left for Dead in Quicksand
events.description: Crocodile throws Luffy's impaled body into the quicksand created by Desert Girasole. Luffy sinks beneath the sand, appearing to be buried alive with a fatal wound and poison coursing through his body. Crocodile walks away victorious.
events.significance: Round 1 ends in Crocodile's complete victory. This devastating loss forces Luffy to grow and adapt. The cliffhanger ending leaves viewers uncertain about Luffy's fate, creating intense dramatic tension.

quotes.speaker: Crocodile
quotes.context: Crocodile arrogantly sets a time limit for his battle with Luffy

quotes.text: I'll take care of this guy. You all go on ahead!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy volunteers to face Crocodile alone

quotes.speaker: Crocodile

themes.description: Luffy willingly puts himself in mortal danger to protect Vivi and allow his crew to continue their mission. His selfless decision to face Crocodile alone demonstrates his growth as a captain.
themes.symbolism: Luffy switching places with Vivi symbolizes his role as protector of his friends and his willingness to bear any burden for them.

themes.description: This episode explores the theme of confronting an opponent who seems invincible. Luffy's struggle against his first Logia user represents a major challenge that requires more than just determination and strength.
themes.symbolism: Crocodile's sand powers represent insurmountable obstacles that can only be overcome through knowledge and adaptation, not brute force.

themes.description: The desert environment plays a crucial role, giving Crocodile complete home-field advantage. The harsh, unforgiving landscape mirrors the brutal nature of their battle.
themes.symbolism: The desert represents isolation and death, where Crocodile reigns supreme and survival seems impossible.

characterSpotlights.role: Protagonist facing his greatest challenge yet
characterSpotlights.development: Luffy encounters his first Logia Devil Fruit user and learns the hard way that his usual tactics are ineffective. His discovery of water as Crocodile's weakness plants the seed for future victory, but he suffers a devastating defeat.
keyActions: Switches places with Vivi to protect her
Attempts various attacks that prove ineffective
Uses Gomu Gomu no Baku Baku
Gets impaled by Crocodile's poisoned hook
quotes: I'll take care of this guy. You all go on ahead!

characterSpotlights.development: Crocodile showcases his full mastery of the Suna Suna no Mi and his tactical brilliance. He dominates the battle from start to finish, establishing himself as one of the most formidable opponents Luffy has faced.
keyActions: Intercepts the Straw Hats in the desert
Discovers Luffy knows about water weakness
Leaves Luffy to die in quicksand
quotes: Three minutes. That's all the time you have left to live.
You failed, Straw Hat. This is where you die.

characterSpotlights.development: Vivi's capture by Crocodile triggers Luffy's decision to fight alone. Her importance to Luffy and the crew is reinforced by his willingness to sacrifice himself for her safety.
keyActions: Travels with the crew toward Alubarna
Saved by Luffy switching places with her

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the battle sequences with additional animation showing Crocodile's techniques in more detail compared to the manga's shorter depiction.
Some dialogue exchanges are expanded in the anime to build more tension during the confrontation.

trivia.fact: This episode aired on May 5, 2002, which is also Children's Day (Kodomo no Hi) in Japan, a national holiday.
Episode 110 has an IMDB rating of 9.1/10, making it one of the highest-rated episodes of the Arabasta Arc.
This is the first time Luffy faces a Logia-type Devil Fruit user in a serious battle, introducing viewers to the concept of elemental intangibility.
The technique Desert Spada is named after the Italian word 'spada' meaning 'sword', reflecting Crocodile's refined and calculated fighting style.
Gomu Gomu no Baku Baku is a reference to Wapol's Baku Baku no Mi from the Drum Island Arc, showing Luffy's tendency to copy techniques he's encountered.
